title: Reelected European Commission President von der Leyen keeps act II of Green Pact to bare minimum
summary: Reappointed for a second term on Thursday, the European Commission President focused on defending the industrial aspect of the Green Deal.

title: Macron-supported candidate re-elected as Assemblée Nationale president
summary: Yaël Braun-Pivet was reelected with 220 votes. In 2022, she became the first woman to be elected to this position.

title: Biden nears crunch point as pressure grows to drop out
summary: The 81-year-old Democrat is holed up at his beach house with Covid as multiple US media reports said he was considering the future of his reelection bid amid mounting opposition within his party.

title: Boeing workers vote to authorize a massive strike
summary: The IAM District 751 union is calling for a pay increase of at least 40% over three years.

title: Elbridge Colby, former US deputy secretary of defense: 'We don't want to be the world's policeman'
summary: Elbridge Colby, a Republican specialist in foreign affairs, told Le Monde that Europe needs to 'step up' when it comes to autonomy and defense.

title: In the Donbas, an invisible gulf between the Ukrainian military and civilians accused of 'waiting for Russia'
summary: The small fringe of people still living under the bombs is arousing the suspicion of the Ukrainian military. Are they afraid to leave their homes, or are they spies for the enemy?

title: Man shot dead by police after knifing officer in Paris near Champs-Elysées
summary: An attacker in Paris' luxurious Champs-Elysée neighborhood tried to enter a Louis Vuitton store before being turned away. Holding a knife, he injured a police officer who had been called to secure the store, according to the interior minister.

title: Hunter Biden seeks dismissal of tax and gun cases, citing decision to toss Trump's classified documents case
summary: In a pair of filings Thursday, lawyers for President Biden's son said the same logic should apply in his cases. They have asked for the dismissal of a pending tax prosecution in Los Angeles and a separate firearm case in Delaware, in which Hunter Biden was convicted of three felony charges.

title: Central Paris locks down for Olympics as athletes arrive
summary: French security forces began locking down large parts of the capital ahead of the hugely complex Olympics opening ceremony next week on the Seine.

title: US federal appeals court blocks remainder of Biden's student debt relief plan
summary: In a ruling Thursday, the 8th Circuit Court of Appeals granted a motion for an administrative stay filed by a group of Republican-led states seeking to invalidate the administration's entire student loan forgiveness program.

title: Car crashing into Paris cafe 'could have been intentional,' prosecutor says
summary: The incident took place on Wednesday on the terrace of the Le Ramus bar near the Père-Lachaise cemetery. One person died and six were injured, three of them seriously, according to the prosecutor's office. The 24-year-old driver was taken to a psychiatric hospital.

title: Women come forward to accuse famous French priest of sexual assault
summary: A report commissioned by charities Abbé Pierre founded reveals a pattern of sexual assault committed by the priest from the late 1970s to 2005.

title: Luxury brands and private investors take over the Champs-Elysées
summary: Ambitious real estate projects are on the rise up and down the famous avenue, with LVMH leading the charge. These companies want to make their mark on the street by funding an urban redevelopment plan.

title: J.D. Vance pushes his working-class roots in first speech as Trump's running mate
summary: The 39-year-old senator also attacked President Biden's policies at the convention in Milwaukee on Wednesday.

title: Tour de France: Campenaerts wins stage 18, Pogacar retains lead
summary: Victor Campanaerts of Lotto Dstny won the Tour de France active, hilly stage 18.

title: Our selection of five youth hostels in Paris
summary: Here are five hip and friendly places to stay in Paris on a budget.

title: A glossary to understand the situation in French Parliament and government
summary: France's snap elections have brought some procedural or technical terms back to the forefront: Parliamentary groups, presidency of the Assemblée, caretaker government... Le Monde explains them.

title: France hunts arson suspect after Nice fire kills 7
summary: Rescuers were alerted to the blaze that killed four people on the seventh floor of a building in the low-income neighborhood of Les Moulins in the southern French city.

title: Ursula von der Leyen elected for second term as European Commission president
summary: The German ex-defense minister, who became the first woman leader of the European Commission in 2019, had earlier on Thursday presented herself as the best and most experienced captain to steer the commission.

title: Across India, infrastructure is collapsing one after the other
summary: Several airports and bridges have collapsed, mainly due to rainfall, while the country is building at breakneck speed to maintain its development.

title: Paris 2024: Behind the scenes of the International Broadcast Center, the Olympics' media and technical heart
summary: The International Broadcast Center at the Le Bourget Exhibition Center will host between 8,000 and 10,000 journalists every day. All images and sound from the competition will transit through this highly secure site.
